verse.devanagari:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
ज्ञानकर्मसंन्यासयोगो नाम चतुर्थोऽध्यायः ||४||
verse.transliteration: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde jñānakarmasaṃnyāsayogo nāma caturtho.adhyāyaḥ ||4-43||
verse.meaning: Swami Sivananda did not comment on this sloka

verse.devanagari: देवताभ्यः पितृभ्यश्च महायोगिभ्य एव च। नमः स्वधायै स्वाहायै नित्यमेव नमो नमः॥
verse.transliteration: devatābhyaḥ pitṛbhyaś ca mahāyogibhya eva ca | namaḥ svadhāyai svāhāyai nityam eva namo namaḥ ||
verse.meaning: Salutations to the gods, to the ancestors, and to the great yogis. Obeisance to Svadha and Svaha, eternal salutations again and again.

verse.devanagari:
सञ्जय उवाच |
इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः |
संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||१८-७४||
verse.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca .
ityahaṃ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ .
saṃvādamimamaśrauṣamadbhutaṃ romaharṣaṇam ||18-74||
verse.meaning: 18.74 Sanjaya said  Thus I have heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes the hair to stand on end.

verse.devanagari:
ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च |
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ||१४-२७||
verse.transliteration:
brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāhamamṛtasyāvyayasya ca .
śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca ||14-27||
verse.meaning: 14.27 For I am the abode of Brahman, the immortal and the immutable, of everlasting Dharma and of absolute bliss.

verse.devanagari: वक्रतुण्ड महाकाय सूर्यकोटि समप्रभ। निर्विघ्नं कुरु मे देव सर्वकार्येषु सर्वदा॥
verse.transliteration: vakratuṇḍa mahākāya sūryakoṭi samaprabha | nirvighnaṃ kuru me deva sarvakāryeṣu sarvadā ||
verse.meaning: O Lord with a curved trunk and massive form, whose brilliance equals a billion suns — make all my endeavors free of obstacles, always.

verse.devanagari:
धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः |
योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ||१८-३३||
verse.transliteration:
dhṛtyā yayā dhārayate manaḥprāṇendriyakriyāḥ .
yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī ||18-33||
verse.meaning: 18.33 The unwavering firmness by which, through Yoga, the functions of the mind, the life-force and the senses are restrained  that firmness, O Arjuna, is Sattvic (pure).

verse.devanagari:
सञ्जय उवाच |
इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः |
संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ||१८-७४||
verse.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca .
ityahaṃ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ .
saṃvādamimamaśrauṣamadbhutaṃ romaharṣaṇam ||18-74||
verse.meaning: 18.74 Sanjaya said  Thus I have heard this wonderful dialogue between Krishna and the high-souled Arjuna, which causes the hair to stand on end.

verse_of_week.devanagari:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच |
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः |
मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||१-१||
verse_of_week.transliteration:
dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca .
dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ .
māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya ||1-1||
verse_of_week.meaning:
1.1 Dhritarashtra said  What did my people and the sons of Pandu do when they had assembled
together eager for battle on the holy plain of Kurukshetra, O Sanjaya.

lifestyle_recommendations: Amavasya week: spend time in quiet reflection and gratitude for ancestors.
Chaturthi energy: clear one pending task and remove one source of clutter.
Somavara: start the week with a short sankalpa and 10 minutes of silence.
Guruvara: reserve time for study, guidance, or one act of teaching.
Daily anchor: avoid digital overload for one focused hour after sunrise.
